This was my priority 1 school at the time of application. This is a big surprise as I had messed my application up by uploading wrong essays. I had given up on this school because I had never heard anything from it. No interviews, no replies from POI. I had stopped checking the portal. At midnight, the international service office e-mailed me asking for documents to process I-20 and then I went on to check my portal and saw that I was accepted. This was my priority 1 school at the time of application. They said a formal letter will be mailed through postal services. Please do not lose hope, it is not over until you get the rejection letter addressed specifically to you.

To the poster below, I was accepted to the PhD, but no information about funding so far. 
I emailed the director and this was the answer: "If you have not gotten funding then likely you may not get any right now but we can put you on a waiting list.  But while it can be difficult in the first semester to secure funding, I can tell you that most students do so by the start of their second semester. We find that about 90% of our graduate students are funded at any given time."

Thus, for those waiting for acceptance, this may indicates that you may get accepted but probably without funding.
